```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(Hmisc) # some useful functions
library(utils) # for downloading stuff from the internet
library(pastecs) # for summary statistics

```

## Data

This data is from Motor Trend magazine in 1974. 

1. Data overview
```{r summary mtcars}
?mtcars

summary(mtcars)

dim(mtcars) # The first number is the number of rows in the data frame and the second is the number of columns.

names(mtcars)

# Labelling variables
var.labels = c(mpg="Miles per gallon", cyl="Number of cylinders", disp="Displacement", hp="Horsepower", drat="Axle ratio", wt="Weight", qsec="1/4 mile time", vs="V/S", am="Transmission", gear="Number of forward gears", carb="Number of carburetors")

label(mtcars) = lapply(names(var.labels), 
function(x) label(mtcars[,x]) = var.labels[x])

View(mtcars)

```


2. Exploring the variables
```{r descr, echo=FALSE}
stat.desc(mtcars$mpg, basic=FALSE) # summary stats for variables of interest, not very necessary if the summary function will give the whole outputs.
```

## Plots

```{r plots, echo=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
mtcars$am <- factor(mtcars$am,levels=c(0,1),
   labels=c("Automatic","Manual"))
qplot(mtcars$am, mtcars$mpg, geom = "boxplot", main = "MPG by Transmission Type", xlab = "Transmission", ylab = "MPG")

# Some boxplot distributions
boxplot(mtcars, las = 2, ylab="Number of cars", col=c("red", "sienna", "black", "blue", "royalblue", "yellow", "violet", "brown", "green", "palevioletred1", "darkgreen"))


boxplot(mtcars$mpg~mtcars$am, las=2, col=c("yellow", "red"), ylab="Miles per gallon (mpg)", main="Distribution of mpg") # creating boxplots for automatic vs manual cars

par(mfrow=c(1,3)) 
boxplot(mtcars$wt, col="blue", xlab="Weight")
boxplot(mtcars$carb, col="yellow", xlab="Carburetors")
boxplot(mtcars$hp, col="cyan", xlab="Horsepower")

# Looped Histograms
    variables<-names(mtcars)
  for(i in variables)
  {
    colors = c("red", "yellow", "green", "violet", "orange", "blue", "pink", "cyan") 
    dev.new()
    xLabel <- paste(var.labels[i]) 
    hist(mtcars[, i],
    main=paste("Distribution of", xLabel),
    xlab=xLabel)
    
  }
    

```
